publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2734 Chris Ballance: Chernobyl Anniversary—That the Parliament notes that 26 April 2005 is the 19th anniversary of the Chernobyl disaster; remembers those in the Ukraine and elsewhere who died following the explosion and those who continue to suffer ill-health caused by radiation poisoning; is concerned that farmers in Scotland and elsewhere in the United Kingdom continue to face restrictions on the movement and sale of their produce due to radioactive contamination from Chernobyl, and reaffirms that nuclear power can have no place in Scotland’s long-term future. Supported by: Christine Grahame*
S2M-2734 Chernobyl Anniversary (lodged on 26 April 2005) John Swinburne*

S2M-2734 Chris Ballance: Chernobyl Anniversary—That the Parliament notes that 26 April 2005 is the 19th anniversary of the Chernobyl disaster; remembers those in the Ukraine and elsewhere who died following the explosion and those who continue to suffer ill-health caused by radiation poisoning; is concerned that farmers in Scotland and elsewhere in the United Kingdom continue to face restrictions on the movement and sale of their produce due to radioactive contamination from Chernobyl, and reaffirms that nuclear power can have no place in Scotland’s long-term future. Supported by: Christine Grahame, John Swinburne
S2M-2734 Chernobyl Anniversary (lodged on 26 April 2005) Linda Fabiani*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Brian Adam*
S2M-2734 Chernobyl Anniversary (lodged on 26 April 2005) Tommy Sheridan*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-2734 Chernobyl Anniversary (lodged on 26 April 2005) Ms Sandra White*
